data.title: Nothing special
data.text: The kolaches were ok but the rest of the baked goods were not that good.  We were there during Wurstfest and perhaps the big crowds affected their quality.

data.title: An Update
data.text: Need more and better breakfast pastries?  Then Naegelin's is the spot in NB. They also had a booth at the Wurstfest for more German delights.  This time I had only a cheese pocket for breakfast.  Very good flaky pastry, but perhaps a bit more of the cheese filling.  Outdoor seating is  light, so walk over to the town circle and eat there in the gazebo. Also, check out the day-old goods for a less expensive treat. Nest time I'll try the maple glazed, bacon covered pastry!

data.title: Amazing array of delicious goodies!
data.text: Went in to check out the amazing selection of cakes and sweet treats and walked out with the most enormous bag of doughnut holes for my husband. Also some gorgeous strudel and pecan delicacies that disappeared very quickly and put on pounds I didn't need. Definitely worth checking out and the prices were not unreasonable.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Glad you got something for yourself too, Meggles57! Thank you for visiting and sharing some kind words on TripAdvisor. There are plenty more sweet treats waiting for you, so come back soon!

Take care,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Full of family history
data.text:
We've been going here for years. The cherry turnovers (not my normal favorite) are so good I forgo my normal favorites. Fresh and delicious everything.
My wife's Grandmother worked and lived here with her sister when they were 12 years old because they were poor and they needed them to work and live somewhere else as with 8-10 children its was a hard time for all of them to live and eat in the same house.
Her name was Erna Schultz we called her Oma. She was dear and sweet lady who could really cook!

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Always a pleasure to hear from a long time fan, Whitney! Thank you for supporting us as a customer and for sharing your family story. We'd love to catch up next time you visit!

Take care,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Old Fashioned Bakery!
data.text: Came here to the oldest bakery in texas and had a coffee and cookies and good cherry strudel.  Nice spot with a  lot of charm in downtown New Braunfels.  bakery items and coffee were very reasonably prices too!  Check it out!

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for tracking us down, KidLove! Not sure how far you had to travel, but it sounds like it was well worth the journey. If New Braunfels isn't too far from home, we'd love to welcome you back soon!

Take care,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: You CAN go home again😆
data.text:
I went to school with ghe owner's son back in the day. Going to Naeglin's was THE TREAT!
The store us small, housed in an old, old building...but the quality and yumminess factor sitting in fhe display cases is worth the trip.
Prices are fair for goods received.
Remember you are in New Braunfels, so German influence is apparent. 
I had sweet German giant pretzel. Soooo good🤗

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
You've got lots of memories coming here, Ruby, and we're thrilled they're all such happy ones. Thank you for continuing to support us today, not only as a customer but with a glowing five star recommendation too. Hope to see you again very soon!

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Expected more
data.text: Although this bakery is very old and very historic, I was very disappointed with the selection. There was a very limited selection of bread and I was surprised that there were no pretzels in a German bakery. I'm not sure this was worth the stop other than the picture of the outside.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Sherri, it's not clear what time you arrived to peruse our selection, but it sounds like it may have been a bit late in the day to see how many delicious treats we actually offer. In fact, we serve sweet pretzels just like what you were looking for as well as 10 different varieties of breads, 3 varieties of rolls, 3 types of tortillas and hamburger buns. Hope to get another chance to wow you next time you're in the area.

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: #teamthompson
data.text: when we travel we try any bakery we pass. Our middle son has special needs and hopes that every one has a gingerbread man cookie. Not only did Naegelin's have it, but it's one of their specialties and one of the best we've ever had. Our mistake is that we only bought 3.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Guess you'll have to drop by again soon for more gingerbread cookies, Chrystal! Send our thanks to your son for his stamp of approval -- it means the world to us. 

Best wishes to you and your family,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent bakery
data.text: This place is awesome but get there early because you are going to have to wait in line. The secret is already out.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Haha, this review is a wonderful treat, bryanjohnson2016. Thank you for the five stars and kind words! The secret has been out about us for almost 150 years now, so don't worry too much. We'll keep serving up the sweet treats you love!

Come back soon,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great selection and tasty food
data.text: We stopped here on our way out of New Braunfels and were glad we did. Originally we were only getting snacks for us two, but ended up buying over $30 of assorted breads and cakes. When we arrived around 2pm there was no car in the parking lot but us. 15min later we left and the parking lot had over 10 cars. Very popular place and well worth the stop. If your on a diet, don't stop in because you will mess that up <big smile>.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
You showed up at the perfect time, Randy! Thank you for not only paying us a visit but for writing us a glowing recommendation too. Hope the sweet treats kept you happy all the way home!

Come back someday soon,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unimpressed
data.text: Family stopped by Sat. morning. Utilized the drive thru as line was out the door. Ordered half a strudel, a bear claw, fried pies, and a danish.  The fried pies were small and fairly well done with decent flavor. The danish was small also but my daughter liked its texture and flavor.  The bear claw bore no resemblance to a bear claw, we really think they gave us the wrong item. The strudel was very disappointing. The crust was tough, the filling overly sweet and consistency of canned pie filling. My wife is half German and we assure you it was nothing like real German strudel if that is what you are seeking. The drive thru service was friendly and reasonably fast. Only worth going to say you've been to the oldest bakery in Texas and I doubt I would return.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Patrick, it's genuinely disappointing to hear we didn't make a stronger first impression, and if any of our sweets were less than delicious we want to apologize. We've been able to call ourselves the oldest bakery in Texas because we've been delighting our customers consistently for decades, so anytime we miss the mark we take it seriously. Here's hoping you'll give us one more chance next time you're in the area!

Best wishes,

Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Landmark with great treats!
data.text: Historic and delicious! I have great childhood memories of this place and their treats still taste as delicious as ever! I'm a sucker for their bear claws and sweet German pretzels. Naegelin's is a must-visit place for me whenever I'm within driving distance!

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We love to hear from folks who've been savoring our sweet treats their whole lives, Kip. Thank you for coming back years later to revisit your childhood! Your five stars and kind words are just icing on the cake.

Hope to see you again very soon,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A must!!!!!
data.text:
Delicious old bakery.
Been purchasing bake goods from there for 40 yrs.
Try the bear claws, strudel and eclairs!
Yum!

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It's not everyday we hear from someone who's been supporting us for four decades, Honeyfirefly6. Words don't do it justice, but we hope you know how much we appreciate you. This five star recommendation is icing on the cake!

Here's to many more years to come,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Sweets and pies galooore!
data.text: Be prepared to go to the end of the line on a Saturday morning.  But the line moves really fast with 3-4 hosts behind the counter.  This place is popular.  The baked goods are the best and the prices are so reasonable.  Lots of good German goods and you can see everything before you buy, even if you can't pronounce the German name.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Five stars always make our hearts flutter, DoctorJohann! Thank you for the wonderful recommendation and all your kind words, both for our sweet treats and our friendly staff. Hope to see you again soon for more deliciousness!

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Definitely worth making a stop
data.text: On our first trip to New Braufels, and I saw this gem was the oldest bakery in Texas, so I just had to stop in.  They have a LOT of choices. Bear claws, donuts, strudel, bread, cupcakes, pies, rolls, brownies, cookies...just about any baked good you can think of, and the prices were AMAZING!  We just had donuts, because I simply couldn't decide.  They were just ok, but we'll definitely come back and try more goodies each and every time we are in the area.  Family owned, and you can feel it!

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
The great thing about our bakery, Plan_1st, is that no matter what you choose you can rest assured it will be delicious! Thank you so much for visiting us during your stay in New Braunfels and for sharing the experience on TripAdvisor. Can't wait to earn that fifth star next time!

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Delicious baked goods and quick, friendly service. We always visit a time or two when we're in New Braunfels. A Naegelin's pastry and  coffee by the river = Perfect Texas Morning for me.Everything is tasty, but try the big, fat, soft and chewy gingerbread men. So sweet, spicy and delicious. Also the bear claws and the fried pies, cheese pockets . . .

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It sounds like you really know your way around our menu, and we couldn't be happier about that fact -- we love hearing from long time fans! Thank you for taking the time to leave this amazing feedback, and we hope to see you in again for a gingerbread man sometime soon!

Till then, 
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing
data.text:
Every time my family comes out I take them here for the strudel, cookies and doughnuts. Compared to another 'hip' bakery in new braunfels this place takes the cake :) prices are rock bottom and the kids love the smiley face cookies. 
The fried pies are great but by the afternoon they are usually sold out. If you are looking for delicious baked good (breads/rolls/tortillas) or amazing sweets stop by and grab a few. Your wallet won't take a hit and you will walk out happy.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We love family traditions, Jennifer! After all, we've been baking our famous goodies here in New Braunfels almost 150 years. Thank you for sharing us with your family and for spreading the word online too. 

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: All Time Favorite
data.text: I grew up in New Braunfels and Naegelin's was a stop that we made on a weekly basis. When I am in town I always have to stop and bring bags full of yummy goodies to Houston.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Happy to hear from a local, Julie, especially one who's been a fan their whole life. Thank you for the five stars and kind words! 

All the best,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Yummy baked goods
data.text: Love, love, love this historic bakery.  The donuts are great.  We buy springerle cookies every Christmas to send to my 90 year old great uncle - he says they taste like the cookies his German grandparents used to make at a bakery they owned in Kansas.

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We love, love, love you back, PadreGirl! Thanks for making our day with a glowing five star recommendation and a very touching story as well. Tell your great uncle how much we appreciate his kind words!

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Get treats
data.text:
If you have sweet tooth this is the place to go , alot of German sweet treats 
Bear claws,dounuts , german pretzels,  apple studels , ice box cookies , anything your heart or tummy wants ...great place good prices too ...

owner_response.author: Todd G, Owner at Naegelin's Bakery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hope we satisfied your sweet tooth, treborzerp! Thank you for the glowing recommendation. Your kind words made our day! 

Best wishes,
Naegelin's Bakery
owner_response.title: Owner Response
